oai_dc:dc.dc:title: We Shall Not Sleep, 1919 World War I Calendar
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Calendar from 1919 featuring a painting of World War I soldiers, a battlefield cemetery, and the poem "In Flanders Fields" by John McCrae. It also features a brief commentary on the author of the poem and the war by "Black & Black, Makers of Surgical Dressings, etc., Chicago, New York, Toronto."
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Calendars
Broadsides; World War, 1914-1918; Poetry; War Poetry; World War, 1914-1918, Poetry; Calendars; Soldiers; McCrae, John, 1872-1918;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John McCrae served as a surgeon in World War I. He composed his poem "In Flanders Fields" after the death of a friend in the Second Battle of Ypres. He died in 1918 of pneumonia while commanding the No. 3 Canadian General Hospital at Boulogne.
